intro: Desmonema caffra, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its milky sap contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Desmonema caffra is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in full sun.
